posts.title: Harrowing Halloween Recommendations from NYPL's Horror Committee
posts.text: We asked this cadre (or do I mean coven?) of trained professionals, all of them well-versed in everything creepy-crawly, which must-read library books, movies and music they'd recommend to ensure your Halloween is, well... to die for!

posts.title: Make Your Mark: A Celebration of Bookmarks
posts.text: Do bookmarks get the appreciation they deserve? NYPL staff share pictures of their favorite bookmarks.

posts.title: You Think a Pandemic is Scary? Contemporary Horror Picks
posts.text: Go-to horror authors as well as an essential pick for each guaranteed to keep you up at night.

posts.title: Horror Genre Primer
posts.text: A genre expert defines the genre for you, tell you about sub-genres, and gives you some titles to read and recommend. ​

posts.title: Attack of the Killer Bs: B-Movies and Cult Films
posts.text: Watching a bad movie doesn't always have to be a bad experience. Do you like films that are tacky, silly or just plain weird? These titles were made for you.

posts.title: Blurred Lines: Animated Movies For Adults
posts.text: With all the attention given to movies like Frozen, Up and Wreck-It Ralph, it's easy to forget that not all animated films are made with kids in mind. If you're in the mood to watch something animated but not too kid-friendly, here are just a few of your many options.
